intro: Cajuputi leucadendron, commonly known as the silver tree, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage. The plant features a tall, slender trunk with a crown of feathery, white-pink flowers that bloom in spring. Cajuputi leucadendron is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
